rules.natural: If legislation protects artwork, then cultural heritage benefits the community.
Either legislation protects artwork or legislation preserves natural places.
Either tourism damages heritage sites or, in the event that cultural shows attract tourism, cultural heritage benefits the community.
Under the condition that an organization monitors a heritage site, it alerts authorities.
Either the organization monitors the heritage site or the authority inspects the heritage site.
If the authority inspects the heritage site, then tourism does not damage the heritage site.
Whenever the organization documents the condition, tourism does not damage the heritage site.
The organization reports findings only if it documents the condition.
The organization alerts authorities only if it reports findings.
If the government implements policy, then the authority enforces policy.

rules.prover9_expression: (reviews(committee, policy) -> (-(attracts(cultural_show, tourism) -> benefits(cultural_heritage, community)) -> declines(tourism, region)))
rules.natural: If the committee reviews policy, then, provided that attracting cultural shows to tourism does not imply cultural heritage benefits the community, tourism declines in the region.
The government repeals legislation only if it replaces legislation.
Either the government repeals legislation or, if the authority enforces policy, then the committee reviews policy.
If legislation restricts the region, then it designates a heritage site.
Provided that legislation designates a heritage site, the government neglects the heritage site.
Whenever legislation designates a heritage site, development demolishes the heritage site.
Under the condition that legislation designates a heritage site, conservation conserves the heritage site.
Either the government funds conservation or, if conservation conserves the heritage site, then development does not demolish the heritage site.
If legislation promotes cultural shows, then cultural heritage benefits the community.
Either legislation promotes cultural shows or the region supports cultural shows.
The region supports cultural shows only if they attract tourism.
If it is not true that preserving natural places by legislation results in cultural heritage benefiting the community, then legislation restricts the region.
In the event that designating a heritage site by legislation does not imply the government does not neglect the heritage site, the community protests neglect.
If it is not the case that designating a heritage site by legislation leads to the government not neglecting the heritage site, then the community does not protest neglect.

facts.natural: Tourism does not decline in the region.
The government does not replace legislation.
The government does not fund conservation.

(A1 → G).natural: If legislation protects artwork, then cultural heritage benefits the community.

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either legislation protects artwork or legislation preserves natural places.

(A10 → G).natural: Provided that cultural shows attract tourism, cultural heritage benefits the community.

(A11 ∨ (A10 → G)).natural: Either tourism damages heritage sites or, in the event that cultural shows attract tourism, cultural heritage benefits the community.

(A12 → A14).natural: Whenever an organization monitors a heritage site, it documents the condition.

(A12 → A15).natural: Whenever an organization monitors a heritage site, it reports findings.

(A12 → ¬A11).natural: If an organization monitors a heritage site, then it is not the case that tourism damages the heritage site.

(A12 ∨ A13).natural: Either the organization monitors the heritage site or the authority inspects the heritage site.

(A13 → ¬A11).natural: If the authority inspects the heritage site, then tourism does not damage the heritage site.

(A14 → ¬A11).natural: Whenever the organization documents the condition, tourism does not damage the heritage site.

(A15 → A14).natural: The organization reports findings only if it documents the condition.

(A16 → A15).natural: The organization alerts authorities only if it reports findings.

(A2 → G).natural: Provided that legislation preserves natural places, cultural heritage benefits the community.
